Method Detail

recieveAndFilterData

public void recieveAndFilterData(HttpServletRequest request,
                                 HttpServletResponse response)
                          throws IOException

used when the server recieves an HTTP GET This method sends a request to the corresponding URI at the CRUD server. The function then receives what is returned and xslt transforms it and sends it to the client

Parameters:
request - an HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client has made of the servlet
response - an HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client
Throws:
IOException

filterAndSubmitData

public void filterAndSubmitData(HttpServletRequest request,
                                HttpServletResponse response)
                         throws IOException
Here we recieve data wia a PUT request. We xslt transform these data and forward them somewhere else on the net again using a PUT

Parameters:
request - an HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client has made of the servlet
response - an HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client
Throws:
IOException

setCredentials

public void setCredentials(HttpServletRequest request,
                           HttpClient client)

When talking to the remote server we have to authenticate. Here we handle those gory details.

Parameters:
request - an HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client has made of the servlet
client - an apache commons HTTP client object

setStart

public void setStart()

Used for logging and benchmarking of how long the processing takes. Called when starting the processing of a request. More clever. It calculates start time itself ;)

workDone

public void workDone()

Used for logging and benchmarking of how long the processing takes. When the start has been set using, it will add a time entry to the log.

See Also:
